Title: the opening night excitation

Caption: A short time ago in an apartment in Pasadena….
THE BIG BANG THEORY
EPISODE 194
THE OPENING NIGHT EXCITATION
It is a period of great tension. Our heroes, Leonard, Sheldon, Wolowitz and Koothrappali know that tickets to the new Star Wars movie are about to be available for pre-sale.
If they fail in their mission and can’t see it on opening night Sheldon has sworn that they will never hear the end of it for the rest of their lives…
They believe him.
A few hours later, in a bedroom not far away….
Leonard: Guys, tickets already went on sale.
I don’t know what to tell you, but they’re on sale.
Yeah, me, too.
I’m also really happy, but I can’t pretend it’s for you. New Star Wars in three days.
I think Penny has a point. You can see it another day.
I know. It’s still gonna be weird to see the movie without him.
Hey. We’re going to the comic book store. You want to come?
You got it. Well, Penny might want to join us.
What do you think about giving Sheldon’s ticket to Stuart?
He’s not that bad. Hey, Stuart, got any plans Thursday night?
Well…
Yeah, the wait is finally over.
We will.
We’re gonna have so much more fun than him.
Yeah, he’s on his way. Time for bladder check.
Check.
Um, hey, Wil. What you doin’?
So, if you don’t like Star Wars, why are you here?
Yeah. No matter what happens, we’re coming back tomorrow to watch it again.
I’m really nervous.
That’s true.
Sheldon: What?
The Web site’s frozen. I can’t get in.

All right, this goes against everything I stand for, but desperate times call for desperate measures. Lord, this is Sheldon Cooper. You’re good friends with my mom. I know I’ve spent my life denying that you exist.
And I will continue to do so!
Oh, thank you.
Hey, Thursday can’t get here soon enough. I’m taking off work to watch the original trilogy while I eat enough Star Wars cereal to choke a Wookiee.
And you do realize I bought my ticket when Amy and I were broken up? I hope you didn’t need anything in that case, ’cause it’s closed.
But someone might spoil the movie. No one can spoil Amy’s birthday for me. Surprise, she’s even older. Who saw that coming?
Arthur, what brings you back?
In the past, you’ve come to me when I’m struggling with a dilemma.
Well, my friends are telling me I shouldn’t abandon my girlfriend on her birthday to see the new Star Wars movie.
Those are the robes of the Jedi, the guardians of peace and justice in the galaxy.
So, you agree with my friends that I should skip the premiere?
Yes. But she knows how important Star Wars is to me.
By seeing the movie she’d want me to see?
You’re right.
Where are you going?
I wanted to let you know I’ll be spending your birthday with you.
See, I, I had tickets to the Star Wars premiere that night, but Professor Proton came to me in a dream dressed as Obi-Wan Kenobi and convinced me I should be with you.
I’ll, I’ll let you get back to sleep now. Good night.
It’s late. Got to go. Bye.
Hello.

No, I can’t. I need to make preparations for Amy’s birthday. Which leads me to the following bit of business. This is my ticket to Star Wars. I don’t have to tell you it is worth far more than its face value of fifteen dollars and fifty cents. I trust you’ll give it to someone worthy.
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Penny.
(Knock, knock, knock) Bernadette. (Knock, knock, knock) Bernadette. (Knock, knock, knock) Bernadette.
Keep it up. I got nowhere else to be.
For future reference, if I want to watch Mean Girls, I’ll stream it on Netflix.
Well, as you know, I’ll be celebrating Amy’s birthday with her, and I could use your assistance in helping me select the perfect gift.
Well, so far, I’ve come up with three ideas. The first is a chance for her to play the harp with the L.A. Philharmonic.
Well, I said a chance, you know. When you tell them it’s your birthday at Bennigan’s, they make a fuss. I don’t see why the Philharmonic would be any different.
Well, Amy enjoys knitting her own sweaters, so I was thinking of getting her an all-expense-paid trip to the Wisconsin Sheep and Wool Festival.
No, no, no, no. She’d be going alone. Well, if you think I’m afraid of birds, you should see me around sheep.
That I have coitus with her.
Which do you think she’d prefer? Because I checked the Sheep and Wool Festival Web site, and there’s only 8,000 tickets left.
Intimacy in any form has been challenging for me, but I’d like to show her how important she is, and it feels like now might be the right time.
Then it’s settled. Amy’s birthday present will be my genitals.
You’re back.
I suppose you’re here because I’ve decided to be physical with my girlfriend, and I’ve never done that before.
So, can you help me?
Oh, no. Not that. I, I understand the mechanics.
I think they say junk.
This is an important night for us, and I’m worried I might be overwhelmed and ruin everything.
Thank you, Arthur. You are the wisest of the wise.
Oh, sure. Well, you’re fun to look at.
(Knock, knock, knock) Birthday girl. (Knock, knock, knock) Birthday girl. (Knock, knock, knock) Birthday girl.
Oh.
Hello. Sorry I’m late. I also got you a balloon, but it floated away, and I chased it for a while.
Okay. Ooh, this is different, hmm? Candles and music.
It’s kind of spooky.
No, no, no. It’s your birthday. As long as no one jumps out in a hockey mask, I’ll be fine.
I thought I could take you out to a nice birthday dinner. If we pick a place east of here, we might find the balloon.
Oh. All right. Um. I should probably tell you something about this gift.
Yes. May I ask you a question before I give it to you?
Why are we saying give it to you like that?
I see. Is that all right? I’m sorry, but this is a litigious society. I’m gonna need verbal consent.
You know what, let me pull a quick contract off the Internet.
Hello.
All right. Hello.
Why are you shaking? Are you cold?
Why?
Neither do I. But we can find out together.
Well, I enjoyed that more than I thought I would.
I look forward to your next birthday when we do it again.
Arthur. What are you doing here? I, I don’t think I need any more advice.
Oh. It was amazing. I, I saw it a few days later. What a movie.
Oh. Uh, uh, she liked it fine. But she doesn’t have the history with the franchise I do.
Howard: They’re not supposed to be available yet.
Well, we could wait a couple days and see it together. (all laugh)
It’s like going with your grandpa. Instead of eating popcorn, he brings little pieces of chicken in Tupperware and a thermos full of soup.
Oh, make sure to wear sensible shoes. Wil, want to go to Star Wars Thursday?
Check. Wait. Screw it. I’m holding it.
I know. We’ve been waiting so long for this.
Raj: Wait. You’re sure they’re Star Wars tickets?
Good for Sheldon deciding to stay with Amy on her birthday.
I don’t know. Have you ever seen a movie with Stuart before?
I can’t believe Sheldon gave this up.
Oh, did you hear from Wil?
Is it bad? Did you hear something? Oh, my God. It’s bad. Somebody kill me.
And we’ve built it up in our heads so much.
I don’t think I can walk right now.
Penny: I’m really happy you and Amy are back together.
Uh, sweetie, you do realize Thursday is Amy’s birthday.
You guys just got back together. You might not want to ditch her on her birthday.
Aw, that’s nice. Put that on her cake.
Well, find out.
Come in.
We’re sorry. What do you need?
Wow. You can really arrange that?
Sorry. I was waiting for the bazinga.
Okay, well, what’s the third option?
Okay, okay, okay, okay, okay. Let’s, let’s, let’s just recap our options. All right, we’ve got harp thing, sheep thing.
Sheldon, being physical with Amy is a huge step for you.
Sheldon, that’s so beautiful.
Well, you’re spending your birthday with Sheldon. Why not celebrate early?
Sure, sure. Or we could take you to get a bikini wax.
Uh, I don’t know. It was just a thought.
Oh, we just want you to be prepared for any surprises that might happen tomorrow.
Yes. He said he wants to do something to show you how much you mean to him.
I know. Then you’ll finally stop talking about it.
Have fun, guys.
Knowing them, they will.
I don’t know. He said he’s ready.
Well, I’m gonna stay positive. I mean, we talked, I told him what women like, and after he stopped giggling, he seemed pretty sure of himself.
Arthur: Oh, great. This again.
Uh, beats me. I, I just hope this isn’t a, a sex dream.
And, and the one time where, where you were afraid, and you needed me for, for a night light. What’s, what’s troubling you?
Well, sounds right. Can, can I get out of this muumuu now?
And they, they, they don’t wear underwear.
Uh, do, do you love this girl?
Well, maybe you should show her how, how important she is to you.
Sheldon, you, you can see this movie whenever you want. But you only have a limited number of days that you, you can be with this woman. Be with her.
Great.
I don’t know, but hopefully, somewhere I can wear pants.
Why isn’t it ever Angie Dickinson’s bedroom?
It, it doesn’t seem like it’s up to me.
Eh, excuse me for a moment. Well, it was worth a shot.
Uh, all right. Um, once, once the man gets the, the woman out of her, out of her bloomers…
Oh, good, good. ‘Cause, uh, I have no idea what kids these days are calling their, their parts.
What is happening to this world? What, what do you actually need to know?
Sheldon, if, if you’re with the right person, it, it’ll be okay.
Well, that’s, that’s very nice of you to say, but I think I’m just an expression of, of your unconscious mind.
Uh, Sheldon? Sheldon?
I, I was just curious. How, how’d it go?
But, uh, what, what about Amy?
Okay. Good, good talk.
Amy: Okay. Good night. Wait. Um, Sheldon, were you actually not gonna spend my birthday with me?
I heard that new Mexican place on Green Street is good.
Why would I get a bikini wax for my birthday?
I think I’ll just stick to Mexican.
You shut your damn mouth. You actually heard him say this?
I, I can’t believe it. I, I don’t know what to say.
I do know what to say. Let’s get me waxed.
That’s okay. Come on in. Thank you. Um, I’ll, I’m gonna go put these in water.
So, what’d you have in mind for tonight?
Um, that sounds nice, but I’m not really hungry right now. I thought maybe we could do presents first.
You mean before you give it to me?
Sheldon, I know your present is for us to be intimate tonight.
So, um, should I get under the covers with you?
Well, I’ve been waiting for this for so long, I’ve just built it up in my head. I don’t know what to expect.
Sheldon (to Howard): This is my ticket to Star Wars….
Bernadette: What happens if I say, come in?
How about something a little more realistic?
Hold on. It could be romantic. The two of them away together, keeping each other warm in snowy Wisconsin.
Yeah, are you ready for this?
So where do you want to go?
Great. And then maybe after, we can watch a dirty movie, and if anybody has any questions about what happened or how, we can answer them.
We don’t want to spoil anything, but you should know that Sheldon said he’s ready to be physical.
Well, we’re really happy for you, and we know how much he cares…
Do you think Sheldon’s actually gonna go through with it?
Yeah, but he also swore this was the year he’d be able to pull the guts out of a pumpkin.
Stuart: My, uh, my doctor’s worried about my circulation, so I was thinking about walking around the mall. Why?
Fine, take Wil. See if he brings you clam chowder.
Wil: I was on Star Trek. Just rooting for the home team.
Yeah? Live long and suck it.
Oh, I’m just having fun. Everyone takes Star Wars so seriously. Like if the movie’s bad, it’s gonna ruin their lives.
See? That’s what I mean. When you wake up in the morning, whether this is the greatest movie ever or a total piece of crap, your life isn’t gonna change at all.
Although, we all remember Jar Jar.
I enjoyed that more than I thought I would.

That I have coitus with her.

I don’t know. Have you ever seen a movie with Stuart before?
It’s like going with your grandpa. Instead of eating popcorn, he brings little pieces of chicken in Tupperware and a thermos full of soup.
He’s not that bad. Hey, Stuart, got any plans Thursday night?
My, uh, my doctor’s worried about my circulation, so I was thinking about walking around the mall. Why?
Oh, make sure to wear sensible shoes. Wil, want to go to Star Wars Thursday?
Fine, take Wil. See if he brings you clam chowder.

Well, that’s, that’s very nice of you to say, but I think I’m just an expression of, of your unconscious mind.
Oh, sure. Well, you’re fun to look at.
Yeah, the wait is finally over.
I know. Then you’ll finally stop talking about it.

We’re gonna have so much more fun than him.
Oh, did you hear from Wil?
Yeah, he’s on his way. Time for bladder check.
Check. Wait. Screw it. I’m holding it.

Yeah? Live long and suck it.
(Knock, knock, knock) Birthday girl. (Knock, knock, knock) Birthday girl. (Knock, knock, knock) Birthday girl.
Hello. Sorry I’m late. I also got you a balloon, but it floated away, and I chased it for a while.
That’s okay. Come on in. Thank you. Um, I’ll, I’m gonna go put these in water.
Okay. Ooh, this is different, hmm? Candles and music.
No, no, no. It’s your birthday. As long as no one jumps out in a hockey mask, I’ll be fine.
So, what’d you have in mind for tonight?
I thought I could take you out to a nice birthday dinner. If we pick a place east of here, we might find the balloon.
Um, that sounds nice, but I’m not really hungry right now. I thought maybe we could do presents first.
Oh. All right. Um. I should probably tell you something about this gift.
You mean before you give it to me?
Yes. May I ask you a question before I give it to you?
Why are we saying give it to you like that?
Sheldon, I know your present is for us to be intimate tonight.
I see. Is that all right? I’m sorry, but this is a litigious society. I’m gonna need verbal consent.
You know what, let me pull a quick contract off the Internet.
So, if you don’t like Star Wars, why are you here?

Is it bad? Did you hear something? Oh, my God. It’s bad. Somebody kill me.

Yeah. No matter what happens, we’re coming back tomorrow to watch it again.

Well, I enjoyed that more than I thought I would.

I, I was just curious. How, how’d it go?
